Abscess: Limited range of motion if near a joint
Anthrax:
Anthrax Symptoms

Symptoms vary depending on how you were infected

Cutaneous Skin

 Itchy bump resembling an insect bite that develops into a painless sore with a black center
 Swelling in the sore and nearby lymph glands

Inhalation

 Flulike symptoms

and cough
 Chest discomfort
 Shortness of breath
 Coughing up blood
 Nausea

and abdominal pain
 Bloody diarrhea
 Loss of appetite
 Fever

Injection

 Fever and chills
 A group of small bumps or blisters that may itch at the injection site
 A painless sore with a black center that develops at the injection site
 Swelling in the sore and nearby lymph glands

Seek immediate medical attention if you suspect exposure to anthrax
Athlete's Foot: Burning or stinging between the toes
Bacterial Infections: Heat at the site of infection
Urinary Tract Infections: Pain or burning sensation when urinating
Feeling the urge to urinate despite having an empty bladder
Bone Infections: Redness of the skin over the infected area
Drainage of pus through the skin
Plague: Swollen lymph nodes buboes in the groin
C. diff Infections: Watery diarrhea at least three times a day for two or more days
Yeast Infections: Itching and irritation in the vagina or surrounding area
especially during intercourse or while urinating
Redness and swelling of the vulva
odorfree vaginal discharge that resembles cottage cheese
Chikungunya: Joint pain especially in the wrists
and small joints of the hands and feet
Gonorrhea:
Men

 Burning sensation when urinating
 White

or green discharge from the penis
 Pain or swelling in the testicles

Women

 Increased vaginal discharge
 Painful or burning sensation when urinating
 Vaginal bleeding between periods
 Pelvic pain

Both

 Anal itching
 Puslike discharge from the rectum
 Painful bowel movements
 Sore throat from oral sex

with symptoms like

 Fever
 Sore throat
 Fatigue
 Swollen glands

fluidfilled blisters cold sores on the lips
Oozing and crusting of the blisters
Soreness and pain around the affected area
Genital Warts: or gray bumps in the genital area
Itching or discomfort in the genital area
Pink Eye: Redness in one or both eyes
Itchiness in one or both eyes
A gritty feeling in one or both eyes
A discharge in one or both eyes
COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease 2019): Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
New loss of taste or smell
Fungal Infections: White patches in the mouth or throat
Diphtheria: Swollen lymph nodes in the neck
Skin lesions sores that are grayish or black
Genital Herpes: Pain or itching around your genitals
Small red bumps or tiny white blisters
Helicobacter Pylori Infections: Burning pain or aching pain in the abdomen
Abdominal pain thats worse when your stomach is empty
Mycobacterial Infections: Cough that lasts more than  weeks
Hemorrhagic Fevers: Internal and external bleeding mild cases may not have bleeding
Herpes Simplex: Cold sores or fever blisters around the mouth
Itching or tingling around the genitals
HPV: fleshcolored or gray growths in the genital area
Itching or discomfort in the genital area

Bleeding with intercourse
 Its important to note that many people with HPV dont have any symptoms and clear the virus on their own
Infections and Pregnancy: different color or smell than usual
Infectious Arthritis: and redness in the affected joints
Tinea Infections: Hair loss in the affected area
Legionnaires' Disease: Confusion or changes in mental status
Leishmaniasis: which can be painless or painful
Damage to the spleen and liver visceral leishmaniasis
which can cause swelling in these organs
Low red blood cell count anemia
Swelling of the lymph nodes mucosal leishmaniasis
Tetanus: Painful muscle stiffness all over the body
Measles: Kopliks spots tiny white spots with bluishwhite centers inside the mouth
A rash that starts on the face and spreads to the body
MRSA: and painful area on the skin
Pus or drainage from the infected area
Skin abscess a pusfilled pocket under the skin
Mumps: Swollen salivary glands under the ears or jaw causing puffy cheeks

Symptoms vary widely depending on the specific parasite Common symptoms include

Irritability or restlessness due to itching
or other skin irritation around the anus
Warts: Skin growth that looks like a cauliflower or a small button
Pain or tenderness in some cases
Pubic Lice: Intense itching in the genital area
Tiny white or yellowishbrown eggs nits attached to pubic hair
Small blue or gray spots on the skin
Skin irritation and inflammation in the affected area
Streptococcal Infections: Tiny red spots on the roof of the mouth
Swollen lymph nodes in the front of the neck
Scabies: raised bumps may look like pimples or blisters
Burrows or tracks under the skin thin
Smallpox: Skin rash that progresses through stages  flat red spots

or rectum

 Physical abnormalities Cleft lip or palate

Webbed fingers or toes

Delayed motor skills

 Vision or hearing problems

Deafness and hearing loss: Needing others to speak more slowly or loudly
Depressive disorder (depression): Loss of interest or pleasure in activities
Diarrhoeal disease: Frequent loose or watery stools bowel movements
Endometriosis: Pain with bowel movements or urination

HIV and AIDS:
Early stage HIV

 Fever
 Chills
 Rash
 Night sweats
 Muscle aches
 Sore throat
 Fatigue
 Swollen lymph nodes
 Mouth ulcers

Later stage AIDS

 Rapid weight loss
 Recurring fever
 Profuse night sweats
 Extreme tiredness
 Prolonged swelling of the lymph glands
 Diarrhea that lasts for more than a week
 Sores of the mouth
HIV drug resistance: The symptoms of HIV drug resistance are the same as those of HIV infection that is not being treated effectively  These symptoms can vary from person to person

but may include

 Early HIV infection acute retroviral syndrome or ARS  Many people experience flulike symptoms within  weeks of becoming infected with HIV These symptoms can include fever

some people may not experience any symptoms during this stage
 Later stage HIV infection Without treatment
making it difficult for the body to fight off infections and diseases This can lead to a variety of symptoms

including
     Persistent fatigue
     Unexplained weight loss
     Frequent fevers or night sweats
     Swollen lymph nodes in the neck

or groin
     Persistent diarrhea
     White spots or unusual blemishes on the tongue

or on the skin
     Pneumonia
     Shingles
     Other opportunistic infections

It is important to note that

 Not everyone with HIV drug resistance will experience symptoms
 The symptoms of HIV drug resistance can be similar to the symptoms of other conditions 
 The only way to know for sure if you have HIV drug resistance is to get tested 

If you are living with HIV and are experiencing any new or worsening symptoms
it is important to see your healthcare provider as soon as possible
Human papillomavirus and cancer: Most HPV infections have no symptoms and go away on their own However

some types can cause

 Genital warts Small

fleshcolored or gray growths in the genital area
 Cervical cancer Abnormal vaginal bleeding

or pain during sex
 Other cancers Cancers of the vulva
and throat These cancers may cause lumps
Infertility: Inability to get pregnant after  months or more of regular

unprotected sex 

In women 
 Irregular or absent periods
 Painful or heavy periods
 No periods at all
 Pain during sex
 Unusual vaginal discharge
 Symptoms of hormonal imbalances eg

facial hair growth

In men
 Changes in sexual desire
 Problems with erections or ejaculation
 Pain

or a lump in the testicle area
 Small

firm testicles
 Signs of hormonal imbalances eg
Legionellosis: Confusion or changes in mental status
Leprosy: Skin lesions that are lighter than the normal skin color
Malnutrition: Inability to grow or develop properly
Mental disorders: or irritable most of the time
Feeling tired all the time or having trouble sleeping
Migraine and other headache disorders: Pain on one or both sides of the head
Mpox (monkeypox): A rash that can look like pimples or blisters and may be painful or itchy
Multi-drug resistant gonorrhoea: Discharge from the penis or vagina white

or green,
Pain or burning sensation when urinating,
Increased frequency or urgency of urination,
Sore throat if oral sex was performed,
Pain or swelling in the testicles in men,
Pelvic pain in women
Mycetoma: A painless lump under the skin
often on the foot or hand

that grows slowly over months or years
The lump may eventually ooze pus and discharge grains small

hard particles through the skin
The affected area may be swollen
The skin over the lump may be discolored
The infection can spread to the underlying bone
causing pain and difficulty moving the affected area
Noma: Redness or purple discoloration of the affected area
Socalled punched out ulcerations sores on the gums
Noncommunicable diseases:
This is a broad category with many different conditions Some common symptoms of various noncommunicable diseases can include

 Heart disease Chest pain

irregular heartbeat
 Stroke Sudden weakness or numbness in the face

loss of balance
 Cancer Unexplained weight loss

changes in bowel habits
 Diabetes Frequent urination

blurred vision
 Chronic respiratory diseases Shortness of breath
Opioid overdose: Falling asleep or loss of consciousness
Blue or gray fingernails or lips
Podoconiosis (non-filarial lymphoedema): Gradual spread of swelling up the leg
Hardening and thickening of the skin
Preterm birth: Preterm birth itself is a complication of pregnancy and not a disease with symptoms However

it can lead to various health problems in the baby 

Here are some signs and symptoms that may indicate preterm labor

 Regular or frequent contractions the abdomen tightens like a fist
 Low

dull backache
 Pelvic pressure
 Menstruallike cramps
 Vaginal bleeding or spotting
 A change in vaginal discharge watery

or bloody
 A feeling that something isnt right
Rheumatic heart disease: Irregular heartbeat such as palpitations or a fluttering feeling in the chest
Sexually transmitted infections (STIs): Swollen lymph nodes in the groin
Snakebite envenoming: Pain and swelling at the bite site
or bleeding at the bite site
Numbness or tingling around the bite
Sugars and dental caries: Visible holes or pits in the teeth
or white staining on the tooth surface
Taeniasis/cysticercosis: Passing segments of the worm in stool
Trachoma: irritated or scratchy feeling in the eyes
Discharge from the eyes puslike or mucus
Trypanosomiasis, human African (sleeping: Sleep cycle disturbances trouble sleeping at night and staying awake during the day
